thread.title: Above normal temperatures to continue
thread.title_full: Above normal temperatures to continue - Chicago Tribune

author: Tom Skilling
title: Above normal temperatures to continue
text:
Although temperatures will fluctuate somewhat in coming days, readings are forecast to remain above normal through the seven-day cycle. Significantly cooler readings are expected Sunday and Monday, although temperatures will still run above normal. A chance of showers is possible Tuesday night, but any brief showers or sprinkles should not interfere with the Cubs game. A 40 percent chance of showers is expected Wednesday, but the evening will be dry.
The most costly urban fire in U.S. history ($1.5 billion) burned through Oakland, Calif., on Oct. 20, 1991, destroying nearly 3,000 houses and killing 25 people. Diablo winds gusted to 65 mph combined with low humidity and temperatures near 90. The fire stopped spreading by 9 p.m. because winds subsided; otherwise, the entire east Bay area would have burned.
 Weather
